refsect1.title: Summary
refsect1.para: average The avg operator finds the average value of an array attribute.

note.para: The avg operator provides the same functionality as the avg aggregate, but has a different syntax. For details, see the avg aggregate reference.

informalexample.para: This example finds the average value along the second dimension of a 4×4 matrix.

step.para: Create an array named avg_array:--aql CREATE ARRAY avg_array<val:double>[i=0:3,4,0,j=0:3,4,0]; --show-output=no
Store values of 0–15 in avg_array:--afl store(build(avg_array,i*4+j),avg_array); --output-format=auto --chunkify=yes
Find the average value along the dimension j:--afl avg(avg_array,val,j);
